alert.note: Alert for Pondera; Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 7:23PM MDT until June 24 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Pondera and Teton. * WHEN...Until 915 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area through around 830 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conrad, Choteau, Valier, Brady, Farmington, Bynum, Pendroy, Pishkun Reservoir, Collins and Ledger. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
